ai-mn61:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-mn61:2.1_0: Now at that time Venerable Rāhula was staying in Ambalaṭṭhikā.
ai-mn61:2.2_0: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat and went to Ambalaṭṭhika to see Venerable Rāhula.
ai-mn61:2.3_0: Rāhula saw the Buddha coming off in the distance.
ai-mn61:2.4_0: He spread out a seat and placed water for washing the feet.
ai-mn61:2.5_0: The Buddha sat on the seat spread out
ai-mn61:3.1_0: Then the Buddha, leaving a little water in the pot, addressed Rāhula,
ai-mn61:3.2_0: “Rāhula, do you see this little bit of water left in the pot?”
ai-mn61:3.4_0: “That’s how little of the ascetic’s nature is left in those who are not ashamed to tell a deliberate lie.”
ai-mn61:4.1_0: Then the Buddha, tossing away what little water was left in the pot, said to Rāhula,
ai-mn61:4.2_0: “Do you see this little bit of water that was tossed away?”
ai-mn61:4.4_0: “That’s how the ascetic’s nature is tossed away in those who are not ashamed to tell a deliberate lie.”
ai-mn61:5.1_0: Then the Buddha, turning the pot upside down, said to Rāhula,
ai-mn61:5.2_0: “Do you see how this pot is the water pot?”
ai-mn61:5.4_0: “That’s how the ascetic’s nature is turned upside down in those who are not ashamed to tell a deliberate lie.”
ai-mn61:6.1_0: Then the Buddha, turning the pot right side up, said to Rāhula,
ai-mn61:6.2_0: “Do you see how this pot is vacant and hollow?”
ai-mn61:6.4_0: “That’s how vacant and hollow the ascetic’s nature is in those who are not ashamed to tell a deliberate lie.
ai-mn61:7.1_0: Suppose there was a royal bull elephant with tusks like chariot-poles, able to draw a heavy load, pedigree and battle-hardened. In battle it uses its fore-feet and hind-feet, its fore-quarters and hind-quarters, its head, ears, tusks, and tail, but it still protects its trunk.
ai-mn61:7.3_0: ‘This royal bull elephant still protects its trunk.
ai-mn61:7.3_1: because of he does not act
ai-mn61:7.4_0: It has not yet given its life.’
ai-mn61:7.5_0: But when that royal bull elephant ... in battle uses its fore-feet and hind-feet, its fore-quarters and hind-quarters, its head, ears, tusks, and tail, and its trunk, its rider thinks:
ai-mn61:7.5_1: They don’t act with a single word by the hand, thinking,
ai-mn61:7.6_0: ‘This royal bull elephant ... in battle uses its fore-feet and hind-feet, its fore-quarters and hind-quarters, its head, ears, tusks, and tail, and its trunk.
ai-mn61:7.8_0: Now there is nothing that royal bull elephant would not do.’
ai-mn61:7.9_0: In the same way, when someone is not ashamed to tell a deliberate lie, there is no bad deed they would not do, I say.
ai-mn61:7.10_0: So you should train like this: ‘I will not tell a lie, even for a joke.’

ai-mn61:8.4_0: “In the same way, deeds of body, speech, and mind should be done only after repeated checking.
ai-mn61:9.1_0: When you want to act with the body, you should check on that same deed:
ai-mn61:9.2_0: ‘Does this act with the body that I want to do lead to hurting myself, hurting others, or hurting both?
ai-mn61:9.3_0: It’s unskillful, with suffering as its outcome and result.’
ai-mn61:9.4_0: If, while checking in this way, you know:
ai-mn61:9.5_0: ‘This act with the body that I want to do leads to hurting myself, hurting others, or hurting both.
ai-mn61:9.6_0: It’s unskillful, with suffering as its outcome and result.’ To the best of your ability, Rāhula, you should not do such a deed.
ai-mn61:9.7_0: If, while checking in this way, you know:
ai-mn61:9.8_0: ‘This act with the body that I want to do doesn’t lead to hurting myself, hurting others, or hurting both.
ai-mn61:9.9_0: It’s skillful, with happiness as its outcome and result.’ Then, Rāhula, you should do such a deed.

ai-mn61:18.1_0: All the ascetics and brahmins of the past, future, and present who purify their physical, verbal, and mental actions do so after repeatedly checking.
ai-mn61:18.2_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will purify their physical, verbal, and mental actions do so after repeatedly checking.”
ai-mn61:18.3_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the present who are purifying their physical, verbal, and mental actions do so after repeatedly checking.
ai-mn61:18.4_0: So Rāhula, you should train yourself like this: ‘I will purify my physical, verbal, and mental actions after repeatedly checking.’”
ai-mn61:18.6_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn61:18.7_0: Satisfied, Venerable Rāhula was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn61:18.8_0: The first section on Ambapālī is finished.
